sections.title: MBBS Admission in Kerala 2025-26, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, cut-off and Counselling
Kerala MBBS Admission 2025-26: Overview

content.content: kerela is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to india. its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in india, kerela offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. admission to mbbs programs in kerela is conducted through the neet exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.
The mbbs curriculum in kerela spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.

in kerela aspiring mbbs students have a variety of options available for admission. the state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of mbbs seats in kerela can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. for mbbs admission kerela 2025 total 4859 seats are available in government and private medical colleges in kerela. the state has 1 aiims college located in jodhpur and 26 government and 9 private medical colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of mbbs admission for the academic year 2025-26 in kerela including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. for personalized assistance with mbbs admission in india or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at mbbs app.

sections.title: MBBS Admission Kerala 2025-26: Highlights

content.content: Kerala has a total of 33 medical colleges, including 12 government medical colleges, 0 AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), 0 central universities, 1 Deemed university and 20 private medical colleges. The government medical colleges offer 1755 MBBS seats, while the private medical colleges offer 2900 MBBS seats.

content.table:
Application modeOnline
Admission CriteriaNational Entrance Exam
Entrance ExamNational Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)
Examination AuthorityNational Testing Agency (NTA) 
+91 80946-06060

Top  collegesGovernment Medical College Thiruvananthapuram, Government Medical College Kozhikode, Government Medical College Kottayam, Government Medical College Ernakulam, Government Medical College Thrissur

sections.title: Kerala MBBS Admission 2025-26: Seat Matrix

content.content: In Kerala there are total 33 Medical Colleges offers MBBS course and accepting NEET UG. Among, these 12 Govt. Medical Colleges (Include 0-AIIMS & 1-JIPMER), 21 are Private Medical Colleges.There are total 4455 seats for Kerala MBBS. Amongst, 1755 Seats are reserve for Govt. Medical Colleges (Include AIIMS & JIPMER) and 2700 seats are reserve for Private Medical Colleges.

sections.title: College Wise NEET Cutoff (AIQ/SQ) 2023

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

  • As per the eligibility criteria of candidates, the eligible candidates can fill the appliance
  • Candidates need to fill the application form with all the correctand complete information and also make the payment of the application

sections.title: MBBS Admission Kerala Eligibility Criteria

content.list:
• Candidates ought to have to check their qualification rules prior to filling the application structure and it’s important for the possibility to actually look at it.
  • The candidates should be qualified inside the NEET selection test by getting NEET cut off 2025.
  • They need to accomplish at least 50% (40% for SC/ST and 45% for general PH) to qualify NEET 2025 Exam.
  • Competitors ought to be qualified in Physics, Chemistry and Biology/Biotechnology (PCB) in class twelfth with at least 50% (40% for SC/ST classification and 45% for SEBC) in total.
  • Candidates probably scored at least 50% (45% for SEBC) in Biology/Biotechnology in school twelfth.
  • The age of the candidates should be at least 17 years old as on December 31, 2025.

sections.title: Document Required for MBBS Admission Kerala

content.content: Candidates will have to show their original documents in front of concerned authority at the time of admission:

content.list:
• NEET 2025 Admit Card
  • Receipt of Payment of Fees
  • Allotment Letter
  • Proof of Date of Birth
  • Physical Fitness Certificate
  • Transfer Certificate from the last attended institutes
  • Migration Certificate
  • 10+2 Qualifying Examination Pass Certificate and Mark Sheet
  • Eligibility certificates from any the University of Kerala for candidates who have passed their 10+2 qualifying examination from a board other than the Government of Kerala or CBSE or CISCE.

sections.title: Kerala MBBS Admission 2025-26: Reservation

content.content: Kerala Merit List, inclinations of the applicants, accessibility of seats and seat reservation models, CEE will apportion the medical and dental seats for NEET 2025 competitors. The aftereffect of the Kerala MBBS directing will be delivered in web-based mode. Applicants will actually want to really take a look at their outcomes for the main period of NEET MBBS Counselling Kerala by signing in on the KEAM site. Contingent upon the outcome, the applicant should answer to the college they have picked to finish the seat assignment methodology. The seat assignment result will be delivered in light of the applicant’s exhibition at the revealing place. Investigate the Kerala NEET MBBS seat apportioning reservation models from the table below:

content.table:
CategoryReservation
 Ezhava (EZ)9%
 Muslim (MU)8%
Other Backward Hindu (BH)3%
Latin Catholic and Anglo Indian (LA)3%
Dheevara and related communities (DV)2%
 Viswakarma and related communities (VK)2%
Kusavan and related communities (KN)1%
Other Backward Christian (BX)1%
Kudumbi (KU)1%
Scheduled Castes (SC)8%
Scheduled Tribes (ST)2%

sections.title: Useful NEET Rank/College Predictor Tools

content.content: As you know about MBBS App is well known Career Guidance and Educational Consultant Rajasthan India, Offers three valuable tools for medical students in India. Those who have giving NEET exam.
MBBS App, a reputable educational consultancy based in Rajasthan, India, offers three essential tools tailored for students who have appeared for the NEET exam in India.

NEET 2024 College Predictor: This tool assists aspiring medical students by providing insights into potential medical colleges based on their NEET scores. With the competition for seats in medical institutions growing fiercer, this tool helps students find suitable colleges aligned with their performance.

NEET 2024 Rank Predictor: The rank predictor tool helps aspiring medical students estimate their potential rank based on their NEET performance. In the competitive landscape of medical admissions, this tool offers candidates a realistic projection of their standing among their peers.
